website_summaries.verdict: The Fire HD 8 is the little tablet that could. It’s fast enough for note-taking, streaming, and browsing, and it blows away most of the competition at this price point.
pros: It’s got expandable storage, it comes in multiple colors, and it includes Amazon’s digital assistant, Alexa, so you can use voice commands
cons: It’s not the fastest tablet on the block, so it might not be the best for intense work like writing documents or crunching spreadsheets

customer_reviews.title: Apps not compatible
customer_reviews.text: Got the new fire 8 last night and tried to set it up with the apps that I had used on my previous fire tablets. It appears that apps for EA are not longer available. They do not appear in my library nor in the appstore. A rep from Amazon told me that some apps that previously worked are not longer compatible with the new fire. When I commented about not being able to use an app that I got via Amazon and spent money in using Amazon coins, I was more or less told "oh well".
customer_reviews.author: jpb

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish at best
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how sluggish this unit is compared to the updated ipads etc. It's noticeable. I'm debating whether to return mine or not. I'd agree with the other reviewers....the screen is low to mid-grade HD at best...IMO

customer_reviews.title: Crashes

I thought it was Alexa that made it freeze so I turned it off but it still freezes. I was just listening and it stopped reading and didn't respond to touch and I had to restart. Sometimes I'm reading and listening and I wand to pause it to review a line and it freezes and I have to restart. Maybe I just got a lemon but I'm very unhappy.

customer_reviews.title: so closed an application environment you can't even load Firefox or chrome browsers

Since there are lots of sites and application extensions that don't support Amazon's Silk browser (like viewing video on all United Airlines flights and access to my bank), this is no longer a viable tablet and am returning.

customer_reviews.title: It is too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my HD8 tablet, was able to purchase 2 from QVC for 100.00. I can't enjoy the features because it won't stay connected to my wifi. It is also awkward to hold. customer_reviews.title: Worst Kindle Ever
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this Kindle. I'm on my 3rd Kindle Fire 8 and every one have had a faulty touch screen. I'm giving up which is a shame because I loved the Kindle 7 and was excited about getting the extra inch of screen size, but if the screen doesn't work it is useless. Support says they know nothing about the issue, but many others online have the exact same problem. I'm very disappointed in the problem and lack of any kind of update or acknowledgement of it.
customer_reviews.author: McDevil

customer_reviews.title: Virtually Useless
customer_reviews.text: This device is good for nothing. 1. The lock screen advertises at you every time you turn the screen on. You can turn this feature off, but you'll pay $15.00 to turn it off. 2. You cannot access the Google Play store, which means you can download virtually no apps. 3. You cannot access a BlueFire reader app, so any ebook resources (e.g., academic libraries' EBSCO collections) that require it will be useless to you. 4. What you *can* do is buy lots of garbage on Amazon. Essentially, this device is a sales pipeline: it will let you buy anything you want from Amazon, but it won't let you do much else. Buy a real tablet. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Love the new Kindle Fire HD 8 tablet. I purchased it to use in my kitchen mostly for viewing live tv and streaming. It works great and I love the show mode dock. I love having the convenience of Alexa in my kitchen with hands free mode. If I need to ask a question, I just ask and then have the tablet resume my previous function. It's also great that it has my Kindle books there if I choose to read them in color. I do wish there was a cellular version + wifi so if I need data away from home I could connect.

customer_reviews.title: Capable tablet

The interface is designed to get you to buy more items from Amazon, as long as you can get past that it is a fantastic tablet for the money.

customer_reviews.author: bwh44

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level device.

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 8

The main reason it's not 5 stars is because of the sound/volume. I keep muting the device, I've muted all notifications and sounds in the settings, and even have the do not disturb button selected but it won't stay muted. It keeps un-muting itself every few hours even when I'm not using it or touching it. It's aggravating because sometimes I really need it to stay muted but it won't. Also, one of the main apps I used on my old device apparently isn't compatible with my new one which is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieEmAds884

customer_reviews.title: No wonder the warranty is only 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it did OK. It wasn't exactly great for games or movies but got the job done. The touchscreen had fair response and the color was decent. The brightness is what you would expect at this price range. My biggest complaint is that the battery life is extremely short and now it will only charge if I leave it plugged in for almost a full day. On a full charge it drops extremely fast. I'm sure it is the battery but for having this tablet less than a year, I would have hoped that the battery would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: agent8

customer_reviews.title: A lagging device built for one purpose
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like the new Fire 8 tablet, but it had too many problems and issues. There was a terrible lag with any user interface interaction - I'm not sure if it was defective or if this device is just that far behind modern capabilities and expectations. The screen, which I'm sure a few years ago would have been considered brilliant, now looks washed out and faded. The Amazon Fire tablet OS is very crippled - and require extensive work-hardened and side-loads to get back to a more native experience. This tablet is really just all about Amazon content, don't forget that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I like that the battery lasts longer than my previous Fire tablet, and it is lighter. Downloads are faster. However: The display on the 8-inch screen seems much smaller than 8 inches. My apps look funny and some are kinda squished. Some I had to delete altogether because the display made them unusable. And it still uses that crappy Silk browser that frequently freezes up. I just expected so much more from the "new" kindle fire. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: bjb122

customer_reviews.title: Really Basic Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I would only suggest buying this if your budget restricts you from buying a real Android tablet. Between Android and Alexa features, this tablet seems to sacrifice its potential in order to handle the least of both aspects. As an Android tablet, it's severely hindered by the Fire interface and lack of Google Play app support. The majority of interesting apps downloaded from the Amazon store are basically web browsers designed to load a specific website, such as YouTube. As an Alexa device, it doesn't work very well with other devices in the same house. It's slower to respond to commands, and its sound quality is lacking. Really the only thing this tablet has going for it is affordability.
customer_reviews.author: Whateley

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying this size!
customer_reviews.text: Always a joke but when you reach a certain age you do want the print to be larger- and a larger print on a small reader is not a good combo- have a small fire and a nook but neither were large enough for the large print to be easy to read and still fit in my purse- this fits the bill! Back to reading again both the bible and multiple books. Very pleased with the Reader just the perfect size for these old eyes that still love to read!! Great gift to someone who enjoys reading!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Weaver

customer_reviews.title: High hopes!  Let down on all aspects.  Never been able to keep a connection to wifi!
customer_reviews.text: Never has been able to connect to wifi. I didn't get around to trying to use it for a while and the return window closed. I've read online that this is a frequent problem. If you buy one, make sure you use it quickly and check for wifi connectivity. Mine is pretty useless without wifi. I even bought the display charger. I had high hopes for this as a simple way to get online to shop and watch the movie that are available with my prime membership and it has failed on both.
customer_reviews.author: Keiver22

customer_reviews.title: ok tablet
customer_reviews.text: Ok tablet. It will not run android programs, Even when their os is an overlay of android os. Their app store is not as comprehensive as google play store. The mobile apps that I use for banking, doctors, pharmacy..........are not available on the fire app store. I am very disappointed. Up date:: They contacted me for input on what I was looking for that was unavailable. They are going to reach out to the companies to see if they will make some of these available to us. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tbearman

customer_reviews.title: Bloatware and pop-up ads were maddening
customer_reviews.text: Took some work to get rid of the pop-ups and put play store and add google for a browser, but almost finished with my quest. Nice size, relatively fast, not heavy, overall good value if you can live with the limited Amazon apps. That said, will never buy another one. Amazon has become far too proprietary for me. In fairness, I am not a PRIME member and do not use this for gaming or movies. $15 to remove the bloatware? Really? "Special offers" are more special to Amazon than to users in my opinion. This tablet could have been great instead of just another tablet.
customer_reviews.author: sirlensalot

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who sits long hours during Dialysis. He really enjoys watch movies with Prime. he takes it with him. Everywhere he goes. . I bought mine last year and its still going strong. . I recommend you pair it with Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Innocence

customer_reviews.title: Not convinced
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I'm going to keep this. I am struggling to get into Google Play Store. I have a Samsung tablet and phone. I ordered this mostly for searching the web, but I am discovering that everything is different. I can't get my Ring doorbell app to sync. I don't know.... I ordered it from QVC, so I have time to decide but so far not thrilled. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at the complete lack of instructions for this item. Speaker is very bad, almost worthless. Touchscreen is a little balky, but I an deal with it. Don't know about battery power, haven't used it enough. Limits you to "alexa" or "amazon". We use "Echo" as the wakeup word, don't quite understand why this limitation. It is irritating to say the least. Still working with it. Undecided if will keep it, I don't really know how it will ever work with the Alexa with the poor speaker. For the price, it does some basic tasks well, but my iPad will do them a lot better (except the Echo connection) and it is 5 years old! Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Had decent hopes, but I returned it after two days
customer_reviews.text: Definitely give amazon props for creating a cheap tablet, gives people an option for a lower price... but there is a reason that this thing is mostly for kids. It is BLOATED with amazon stuff and it is just too dang slow. The screen resolution is ok but the brightness is lacking. The speakers are extremely bad and you definitely need to have it connected to an external bluetooth to watch anything with decent sound. I only recommend this for the use of kids, and not even young teens, but literally <8, because from what I've heard the ability to restrict kids to a certain time limit on these things is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun Patel

customer_reviews.title: Outdated, cheap, crappy
customer_reviews.text: This is "meh" for a low end tablet as far as processing speed, touchscreen sensitivity and all the other features are concerned but for the price I wasn't expecting much. It lags and you have to touch stuff multiple times. I'm returning this. Also, it has tabs for recommendations that you can't remove. This tablet is basically one huge Amazon advertisement. The real kicker: the Amazon app doesn't work on this thing, the android version is too outdated lol!! On this tablet that has "amazon" across the back, you're going to have to go to their site through a browser.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Slow and glitchy
customer_reviews.text: This was my 5th Fire before I returned it. My 8.9 and 7" HDX have worked fine for years. Some apps won't update on the older HDX so I wanted a new one. I bought and returned the $69 model. It was just awful. So slow it was useless. On this model, I got the 32 GB model. It was slower than expected, but still usable. What I couldn't live with was it freezing up requiring restarts. I kept it for 3 weeks and seriously tried to love it, but it was not for me. My 7" HDX from 2014 is back in service. Even my 1st Fire from 2011 is more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Tania Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and built to die. Pay for the insurance or regret your purchase soon.
customer_reviews.text: ***90 DAY WARRANTY ONLY*** Worked great for 5 months, then it stopped charging all the time. Then it stopped charging all together. It's dead. Can't do anything. I did not pay for the extra insurance because I have always had good quality products from the fire line until now. It's sad that they only carry a 90 day warranty on brand new current gen products. They will only give me a coupon for 25% off a new one. I just paid my last installment one the one that died. If. I get another, I'll just by a used one from Offer up or Facebook market place. Or maybe I'll get something of better quality like a Samsung Tab. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: TechAaronLoyd

customer_reviews.title: Works great, much lighter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why other reviewers don't like this. I love it. It is light weight and works well. If you are expecting something other than a kindle fire you should look elsewhere. I love the fires, they make reading books and watching videos easy. The silk web browser works well and I have enjoyed the addition of Alexa. I do not buy a kindle because I need a tablet. It is a convenient tool to take with me when I travel for reading and finding fun things to do in the area I am in. I also love being able to sync my email accounts to keep in touch.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: extremely slow
customer_reviews.text: I cannot express how much I hate this new kindle. It has a 3-5 second pause, on good days, usually longer for every function even auto rotate. Amazon music pauses mid song every couple songs to search even though I show 4-5 bars for wifi. It is probably 10 times slower than the kindle fire I bought 4-5 years ago but like all my previous kindles the plug in quit charging. I'm going to go to a different brand next time and I've owned kindles for over a decade
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Attaching bluetooth earbuds has proven impossible so far. On the bluetooth screen on my Kindle Fire 8HD, it displays several hexadecimal device names (52:69:D1:99:....) Which one is my ear buds I don't know. Thus, I can't watch movies on it, though I probably wouldn't anyway since I have an iPad which is much better for this purpose. The device is good for reading books, but all the ads that it conveys on the opening screen and elsewhere are annoying. I've also been unable to find the clippings file from the 70 or so books I read on the old Kindle this Fire HD8 replaces. Disappointing overall.
customer_reviews.author: DMac

customer_reviews.title: Fire 8 HD
customer_reviews.text: As a piece of hardware, it's a good value for the money. Perfect for my needs. 6 month complimentary subscription to the Washington Post is nice. The negatives? Like EVERY personal electronic device of any brand, way too much installed bloatware you can't remove. I would prefer to go to an app store and download only what I want or need. Not a fan of the Silk browser. If the OS is an Amazon variant of Android, just load Chrome on the device and be done with it. Have tried twice to install Chrome, no success. What's the secret, I've read it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N.

customer_reviews.title: Feng Shui
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. I love the mini card feature so that I can download many many things to watch while traveling and working off grid. It's a good size, it's holdable and the image quality is good. It is easy to pack and I don't worry about it like I would my iPad. I keep it in the Amazon case (any case would do) and slip it in a backpack. The sound quality is fine for movies. It easily syncs to wireless headphones. I have a Fire HD10 and have in the past had an HD6. This one is probably the best size for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: C.P.

customer_reviews.title: No split screen for reading books😥
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid reader on my kindle hdx 8.9 for years and when my battery died and couldn't be replaced I purchased this kindle fire HD 8" I received it yesterday and discovered it doesn't have a split screen for reading books so I called customer service and she discovered it wasn't in the 8th generation software. It's in my husband's 6th generation HD 8" .She 's going to request a software update to include it so I'm waiting & hoping or I'll have to send it back. The 8.9 was superior in almost all ways please make it again!!! Faithful Amazon prime customer
customer_reviews.author: Truth seeker

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: The screen quality is great for the price. Much better than my kindle7 5th generation which I replaced this with. The reason I replaced the older one was the battery wasn't keeping a charge. I figured I might as well throw $20 on top of what a new battery would cost and buy a new tablet. The problem is this new 8" fully charged doesn't last more than 2 hours. I can't read an entire book or stream a whole movie. Also the touch screen is not as perceptive. I really have to give a good tap. I really wonder if I received a refurbished item.
customer_reviews.author: LivingInSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to check what can be downloaded on the Amazon Fire
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this tablet at all. I am a diehard Apple fan. I bought the Amazon Fire to carry when I travel because it’s lighter. I travel a lot. The main reason I bought the Amazon Fire is to have a lightweight reader. I have almost 2000 books on my Nook app. I wanted to be able to download my Nook app on the Amazon Fire so I can read my books when I travel. Imagine my surprise when I found out the Nook app cannot be downloaded on the Fire. I called Amazon Customer Service and they were very kind, but could not help me. So, I will be sending the Fire back. Thank you. Carole W.
customer_reviews.author: carole W

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Can't argue about the price. But I was disappointed with the screen brightness, sharpness and color saturation. I returned it the same day it arrived and ordered an HD 10.1, which arrived quickly, with the bright, sharp, colorful screen I expected. You get what you pay for. My first Kindle, an HDX 8.9, was terrific, but lasted slightly more than 2 years before failing. It could not be started, could not be charged, could not be connected to wi-fi and could not be factory reset. It became worthless - a paper weight. Hope the new generation HD 10.1 will last more than two years!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Feeling Nickel and dimed also poor customer experience
customer_reviews.text: I just received this tablet a few hours ago, and my comments are related to first impressions and device setup. I have two major issues with this tablet. First, the advertisements on the home/ lock screen are annoying - so is Amazon's policy of paying to remove them, especially when already paying to be an Amazon Prime customere. Second, Amazon wants me to contact their customer service to install Netflix. Despite prompting me to "contact customer support," instructions were not included in how to do so. This is pretty poor in terms of customer experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: sarah barr

customer_reviews.title: Great screen quality, good size
customer_reviews.text: I love my new tablet. I upgraded from my Kindle HD 7 because it would no longer hold a charge. I love that all of my content downloaded to my new kindle. I did not love trying to figure out how to shut down/off Alexa as I do not wish to use that feature. I also hate the pop up ad on the home screen that I have yet to figure out how to turn off. It keeps offering me free Prime content for magazines, etc. I know how to get to this content if I want it so it is just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah S

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet and price, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet at a great price, but it is useless to me. Sending it back Monday morning. I bought it to primarily use it as an eBook reader. I have a very large library of eBooks in the ePub format. Even though the Amazon App Store lists several ePub Reader Apps. The Brand new Fire 8 HD will not allow me to load any of them. Fine, I went to other sources after changing the Settings to allow outside applications. Sadly it blocks all of them. A new Lenovo Tablet is in my immediate future.
customer_reviews.author: DaddoCFL

customer_reviews.title: Speech to Text? Really? What F!ing year is it?
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Fire 8 HD does not support speech to text. Really? And they made me pay $15 to get rid of ads on the device? Really really? I think I have a flip phone somewhere around here that I can use to call support or maybe I'll send it to them in telegram. JFC.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Moved from an older 7 to this new 8HD. Went from 16Gb to 32Gb. Fast, responsive, nice screen (haven't watched video yet). My biggest surprise is battery life. With my old 7 I might get 5 hours before I had to recharge. With this new 8HD I am getting around 10 to 12 hours. I also like the new official case better than the old one. For the money kindle fires can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Rudolphy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy WITHOFFERS.
customer_reviews.text: Nice table but. DONT BUY WITH OFFERS. there are so many disruptions I can’t complete task or watch movies. It’s horrible.
customer_reviews.author: SandraF

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fire 8 in December 2018. It is now June 30 2019. The battery is no longer charging. I tried multiple chargers and multiple outlets. Battery does not charge anymore. Tried calling customer service and their response was “the warrenty was up after 90 days”. Amazon doens't care about their customers anymore and doesn't stand behind their products. Their customer service employees obviously don't care, either. Spend the extra money and DON'T BUY AMAZON TABLETS ANYMORE. They suck. When big companies get toO big for themselves and stop caring about their customers is when they start going down.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not Even a Year, and it's DEAD!
customer_reviews.text: Well, now I see why it was on sale--Amazon, no doubt, knows these devices black out. Permanently. Doesn't charge. No matter all the tricks tried. No, it's not the cable. No, it's not the charge port. No, it's not...just stop. It's a bunk device. Period. Old saying holds true: you get what you pay for. Shoulda' bought an iPad. Even my NOOK, purchased at B&N over 7 years ago STILL works. And I can get their customer service reps on the phone. Not so with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Karey Brown | Author

customer_reviews.title: Super Slooowwwwwww
customer_reviews.text: It’s just ok. Maybe in a pinch, for kids, or something simple but certainly not a replacement for a real tablet. More like a toy. Wish Amazon would get it together and offer something more solid and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: GinaG

customer_reviews.title: How do I get these ADS to stop interrupting me when I am trying to use the device????
customer_reviews.text: I am so tired of this thing posting ads for totally un-wanted content, like games, shows, etc. I cant hardly use this to read or browse. I am trying to like it - but so far it is irritating me and frustrating. I should not have to put up with this bombardment. I purchase enough from Amazon, I don't need ads to that are irrelevant.
customer_reviews.author: troy hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up on the Black Friday sale, so the price was excellent. I do like the features of this tablet, especially the large micro SD capacity. I use this exclusively for audiobooks so storage space is what I needed most. I previously was using a Samsung Tab, which is very good too, but lacked the internal storage space and could not read the larger micro SD cards. I will say that the case of the Samsung is better quality, but considering the price point difference, I can certainly live with that. Batterly life seems quite long as well, while charging is quick. Hopefully the battery will last a long time too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Kindle we've had so far!
customer_reviews.text: We have had many kindle fires in the past. This one by far has been the worst! Freezes easily. We've only had it for 5 mths and the charging port is broken. We just realized it only had a 90 day warranty after contacting Amazon. Every other one we have gotten had a year warrenty. Luckily the kids only used it for Netflix and hulu. Oh and the battery charge was ridiculously long. It would take 5 hrs to charge and that was with nothing at all running. The battery would last maybe an hour and a half at most. Look for a different model!
customer_reviews.author: Erik Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Covid 19 means no help from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: It will not stay on line. My 6 inch fire won't hold a charge. My 7 inch fire is not HD so rarely gets used until now. I have 4 Kindles. Two Firesticks. A MacBook Air A printer and my phone all which use the internet and have little to no problem staying online except for the 8 inch Fire. I have tried every troubleshooting step and nothing helps. Now with Covid 19 I cannot talk to tech so I have no choice but go without my beloved 8 inch Fire.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lewis

customer_reviews.title: these items are garbage
customer_reviews.text: i initially purchased two devices, six months later they were broken. I called customer service, they told me that i was out of warranty and my only solution will be to buy a new one. on Feb 22nd 2019, i purchased 2 more devices and on June 3rd 2019 they did not work. I wonder if they last long enough just for the warranty period of 90 days. i called customer service and was told the same story. i am giving 1 star just because there is no other lower rating. i strongly suggest to parent to stay away from these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Joel freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great device  for 4&7 yr olds to access audio book libraries and nothing else with curfew
customer_reviews.text: Screen saver ads are sad forced advertising and there is no way to turn them off. Amazon does let you lock all apps and website surfing and remove Alexa so kids only have access to audiobook libraries with headphone connections so children can select their own audiobook and listen quietly. Also parents are able to only allow homework applications like seesaw and DoJo for kids to access homework in the mornings when they wake up so 7 and 4 yr olds can send any worksheets to the printer themselves. Also parents can set curfew of tablet to shutdown at 7pm or turn off for the day or an hr if chores are not completed with a touch of a button.
customer_reviews.author: HappyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: A Waste!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet doesn't have any way to rotate pictures, so you can turn them to the right nor to the left. And trying to open my phone is Ridiculous! It keeps telling me to "find" it to get a verification code. I have yet to find it, after spending at least 15 hours, every single day and night, since I got this tablet. It's useless to find how-to with a runaround! All it shows is what you have, not how to find/use it. And, when I use the keyboard, I have to pound heavily on the screen, just to get it to come up. Same thing with everything! It's an ordeal to even turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: JoAndra Van Dowall
